wpPost.title: Day One
wpPost.content:
An excellent first day albeit with some minor discretions, 160 miles ridden with the following events in order of occurrence.

0730 Depart Complete Engineering Services Ltd.

0800 Arrive Blood Bikes HQ at Port Road, Carlisle where Dee was interviewed by BBC Radio Cumbria.

0830ish depart Carlisle with a Blood Bikes Escort to the City limits – were they trying to say something?

0915 Dee takes us down the wrong road just after Annan, he must have been concentrating for the first 25 miles. Despite the laminated sat nav still been affixed to Monkeys bike at the back, Dee caught up later.

1015 Arrive Dumfries Whitesands for tea and a bacon roll, Dee ate half his roll placed the uneaten portion on top of his coffee cup, whereupon he was mugged for it by a seagull. No sympathy given by Monkey and Bowie,

1100 just beyond Dumfries a required comfort break in a lay-by, Monkey in full stream drops his left riding glove, no sympathy given be Bowie and Dee.

1300 Nine miles before Newton Stewart Monkeys bike stalls and will not restart until reserve tap is turned on, Dee and Bowie’s bikes have half a tank left??? Frantic ride to the nearest petrol station some nine miles away with suspected bottom lip quiver from Monkey.

1315 Outside Creetown meet with Jock Locke from Blood Bikes Dumfries and Galloway, petrol shortage resolved.

1330 Jock takes us to The Belted Galloway Visitor Centre cafe, where after tea and coffee the owner refused to allow us to pay for the drinks, gave us a £40.00 donation and posted our trip flyer on the notice board – a totally top lady,

1445 Earlston Powerstation Monkey breaks his Cub 50 in the form of a front tyre puncture, with the assistance of Rab Peacock from Drax the bike was fitted with a new inner tube. At this point Monkey blamed Bowie for the absence of inner tube repair kit in our spares pack, Bowie denies all knowledge of such a request.

1715 arrive at the Glenpark Hotel after Bowie takes us the wrong way in Ayr

1730 checked in showered and in the beer garden
